docs.title: CadQuery Script Collection
docs.text: This website presents a collection of 3D-models created by CadQuery source.

docs.title: Description:
docs.text: A fully procedural spiral staircase model generated using CadQuery. This script automates the creation of a classic helical stair structure, featuring a central support column and radially arranged treads. The geometry is optimized for 3D printing and architectural visualization, ensuring a seamless connection between the steps and the central axis.

docs.title: Key Features:
docs.text:
1. Fully Parametric Design: Easily adjust the total height, radius, and number of steps by modifying simple variables in the script.
  2. Automated Step Rotation: The algorithm automatically calculates the necessary rotation angle for each tread based on the step count to ensure a full or partial turn.
  3. Integrated Central Column: Steps are fused to a central pole, creating a sturdy, single-piece solid suitable for FDM/SLA printing.
  4. Clean Topology: Constructed using solid geometry primitives for error-free export to STEP and STL formats.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: A detailed procedural model of a lattice steel transmission tower, commonly used in 35kV high-voltage power lines. Unlike static 3D assets, this model is built using a mathematical approach where every cross-brace and section is calculated based on structural logic. The design features a classic four-legged tapering trunk with cross-arms (traverse) optimized for electrical clearance.

docs.title: Key Features:
docs.text:
1. Geometric Similarity Logic: The lattice sections are generated using triangle similarity algorithms, ensuring perfectly aligned bracing as the tower tapers toward the top.
  2. Modular Truss Structure: Includes the main trunk, ground wire peak, and cross-arms for conductor suspension.
  3. Standard-Based Design: Modeled after industrial blueprints (U35 series), maintaining realistic proportions for height, base width, and traverse span.
  4. Clean Topology for Analysis: Built using solid primitives, making the model suitable for FEA (Finite Element Analysis) or clear architectural visualization.

docs.title: Dimensions (Default U35-3 Specs):
docs.text:
Total Height: 23.5 meters

Base Width: 5.4 meters

Number of Sections: 5 main segments + peak

Profile: Square-section framing (optimized for CAD performance)
